headline: Oven Roasted Potatoes
description: Roasted potatoes coated with olive oil, garlic, herbs, and crushed red pepper flakes make a deliciously crispy, flavor-packed potato side dish.

video.description: See how to make easy oven roasted potatoes.
video.name: Oven Roasted Potatoes

name: Oven Roasted Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
Combine oil, garlic, basil, marjoram, dill, thyme, oregano, parsley, pepper flakes, and salt in a large bowl.
Stir in potatoes until evenly coated. Place potatoes in a single layer on a roasting pan or baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven, turning occasionally to brown on all sides, until tender, about 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very good but i think greasing the pan before putting down the taters would have resulted in a better finish.
This was my first time making potatoes. I added a sweet potato to the recipe and they came out great. Everyone loved them especially my grandson. He asked when I was going to make them again.
This recipe will be a staple at our house. Easy to prep in advance. Satisfied a non-dairy side dish.

The best thing about this recipe is the cooking time and temperature. The values in the recipe make for perfectly cooked potatoes with a crispy exterior. I like to use duck fat instead of olive oil, and a little dried basil and salt and pepper is enough flavoring for me.
Wonderful!!! A big hit with my guy. Great flavor.
I used red potatoes and did not peel. Turned out great.
I paired these potatoes with pecan encrusted oven baked chicken - and did not add the red pepper flakes to prevent the flavors from fighting
Everyone loved these! The only change I made is to leave out the crushed red pepper flakes, because my family doesn't like spicy.
These were great - I did boil the potatoes prior to roasting in the oven
I've made this twice now, no changes. And each time just mixing the oil & herbs together has everyone salivating. Definitely a keeper
Excellent recipe and super easy to make. Kinda freewheeled it with the spices and didn't measure the olive oil but it still turned out great.
delicious, the family are huge fans
Everyone loved them
It was good, but next time I think I’ll go a little easy on the crushed red pepper, just a little spicy for me!!
great recipe. I also add some fresh rosemary.
recipe is fantastic.
Awesome recipe!
Easy and tasty.

I have made this recipe a few times now. It turns out great every time. It deserves 5 stars.
Judy J.

So basically, I used white potatoes and they turned out amazing. I had everything together in the oven before I watched the video so I mixed it a little different than what you showed and I think the cook time could be a little less as I was using a gas convect oven. Regardless, the potatoes were delicious as a side dish with a roasted chicken.... even my wife was impressed. Although it's really a very simple recipe, I can rely on this when one can't really think what to make..... 10/10 ??
Sooo GOOD!
Great recipe, easy to make and done in less than an hour. We will be making it again.

I made this recipe as written the first time with the exception of the dill (I detest dill). They were very good. The second time I sliced red potatoes about 1” thick and dredged them in the oil/spice mixture and laid them flat in a pan. I used the convection oven the second time and cooked them about 12-15 minutes at 425 and then Turned the potatoes over and cooked them an additional 15 minutes. They were crispy on both sides. Very good good
Great easy side dish. Have made several times with red potatoes quartered. Definitely make sure you turn the potatoes! Makes a big difference.
Loved this! I did exclude the dill and pepper and was out of basil. But it was a perfectly flavored roasted potato dish to go with our meal.
I have a huge spice collection so used every one listed. I did increase the oil to 1/4 cup. Used red potatoes and cut them in fourths. Baked at 450 for 30 minutes. These were fantastic.

I didn't use the dill. I love dill pickles but I loathe dill in anything else. So, I did not follow the recipe exactly. I lowered the temperature of the oven based on other comments. They came out great. I usually buy a mix but from now on I will put my own together.
BTW, I use a plastic bowl with a lid on it, toss everything in there and shake it around. No ziplock bags were used in the making of this recipe.

Easy and delicious. A great go to recipe. Followed Valerie’s suggestion to use Herbes de Provence ( which I love anyway) and the red pepper flakes. It was great along side Aldo’s “Saltimbocca di Pollo alla Romana”. Yummy meal!
plus onion powder
simply tasty.
This is my favorite roasted potato recipe... I keep coming back to it!
Love this recipe! My husband asks me to make these all the time now!
Turned out really good. Added frozen broccoli & cauliflower.
I don’t always use the same seasonings but I use this as a common side cause my boyfriend and I love them. Sometimes I cut the potatoes into more of a French fry shape too.
It was delicious! I didn’t add garlic, and I may have add a little more olive oil. I didn’t peel the potatoes which completes them.
This is one of the rare recipes that is spot on in terms is ingredients, time, and temp. Adding this to the rotation.

My family really liked these! I cut the amount of red pepper flakes but should have cut it a little more. Next time I would do 1/2 the called for amount. Note that the recipe picture shows red potatoes with skin on but the recipe calls for peeled. I made them with peeled russet and they were great.

YUM!!! We use standard baking potatoes, don’t bother peeling them, and double all but the oil and pepper flakes. I don’t think the herbs conflict at all. We typically make this alongside the Slow Cooker Cranberry Roast by ATLANTAKIM. The gravy from that accompanies these potatoes magnificently!
This was such an easy recipe that turned out delicious. my kids loved them so much they had them 2 days in a row.
I loved it. SUPER amazing!!
I am in love with this recipe. The flavor is fantastic and they reheat well.
Easy and tasty!

This recipe is very versatile. I’ve used it many times, always adding whatever herbs and spices are complimentary to the main dish for the evening. Couple of tips. One is that after taking the potatoes out of the oven, if you put them on a cooling rack for about 5 minutes, they will not get soggy. Also, I like my potatoes crispy so will usually bake them a bit longer. Just watch for the amount of done ness that you prefer.
Delicious.
Delicious! The herbs make it the perfect roasted potatoes!

I made the recipe mostly as instructed except had to use Garlic powder instead of minced garlic because that was all I had. Also, omitted marjoram because I didn't have any. 
Was still excellent! Company loved them too they asked for recipe to take home. New favorite for our household.

It must be the combination of the marjoram with the other herbs that folks aren’t liking. I don’t have marjoram. So, I just used all the other ingredients, and they turned out stellar! I made these once before with the proper amount of potatoes. This time, I only had three medium-small potatoes. So, I threw in some cauliflower to make up the difference.
Came out great, I doubled the dill weed and ate the potatoes with a couple of strips of bacon, it was delicious.

These are easy and really versatile. I've made them for dinner, and as home fries for brunch. There are never any leftover when I make them! I love that you can personalize the flavor with your own seasonings.
Very good recipe. Has just enough spice with the red pepper flakes. Some say they thought it had too many herbs and they would clash but I don’t find that to be the case at all. Excellent flavor!
very good and tasty, easy to make
Awesome and easy! Tastes great, too! ():0)

This was super delicious. I didn’t have any marjoram or basil, so I used everything else. I also added a 1/2 tsp of onion powder. This was amazing even with the missing ingredients. I can only imagine how much more flavorful it would’ve been with them. My picky eating pre-teen requested it for her lunch the next day after tasting it. Love it love it.
I used different seasonings but we loved it!
Absolutely delicious and super easy! I am allergic to onions, so it is nice to find something I can fix without having to remove the onions and try to substitute something else for the onions.

Been making it for years except I toss the cubed potatoes with the dry herbs first, let it stand for at least 20 minutes then add and toss with olive oil. On the side I saute yellow onions and green peppers and toss with the potatoes after they come out of the oven. I've also added diced ham chunks of Italian sweet sausage (hot is good too ) on occasion. Those wonderful, versatile potatoes! Yum.
Simple and delicious! My only suggestion is check the potatoes after the 20 minute mark. I waited too long after 25 minutes in oven.

I have made this more times than I can count. The only difference being, 375º oven for 60 minutes and I ‘flip’ the potatoes every 15 minutes. Put the cubed RED potatoes into a bowl, drizzle with Olive Oil and seasonings, stir to cover the potatoes (and sometimes baby carrots), put into oven safe baking dish.

While this is ‘Italian’ in seasoning, I also use Tex Mex or Greek seasonings, depending on what the main course is. 

Oh, and Sea Salt and fresh Cracked Pepper is a must.
I'm always making this dish to bring to potlucks. Everyone loves it! I make this basic recipe with yams, sweet potatoes and other vegetables as well.
I would maybe add a touch more salt, but I loved it! Will definitely make it again.
Very good and hubby approved. I skipped the oregano and the red pepper flakes (since I didn’t have any) and used a mix of baby potatoes, halved. Baked on the 2nd rack from the top at 425.
Very good recipe for red skin potatoes . I added carrots.

I minced some fresh garlic ahead of time and stored it in the fridge until it was time for the potatoes. In all of my excitement of mixing the rest of the spices, I had forgotten about the garlic. I would make this again, only add the garlic and hold the red pepper. Maybe add some parmesan or Romano cheese.
This was delicious! I didnt have all the ingredients so i made it with just oregano, dried parsley, paprika and salt and olive oil..and it worked like magic!!

I made this recipe last night for my family. It was absolutely delicious with all the spices coming together. I did not use traditional potatoes since I didn't have any on hand, but used the smaller assorted colored potatoes (purple, white and yellow), and it turned out so fantastic. This is definitely a keeper of a recipe and thank you for sharing such a wonderful recipe.
Excellent! I did not have dill but other than that followed the recipe exactly.
Just right, easy and delish!

I made it by the recipe but cut Russet Potatoes in thin circles. The potatoes tasted good but were not as crisp as I would have liked for them to be. Next time, I will leave off make sure that each potato doesn't overlap with another one and leave off the red pepper flakes because it was too hot for my taste. Very few points on WW so it was a winner for me! I will make them again!
A little spicy which I like and my husband loves, my mother not so much. Otherwise fabulous and easy.
Made no changes. Whole family loved it. Will definitely make again!

This recipe is excellent-made as directed with no changes. My husband & I loved these tasty, crispy on the outside-fluffy on the inside red potatoes. In the recipe rotation with steak dinners! Thank you!

I will continue to use this recipe as a template, but I used different herbs and seasoning, as well as adding minced garlic and sweet onion. I also added 1/4 cup water after the first 10 minutes. This allowed for browned, but softer, well cooked potatoes.

I made these potatoes the other night with a prime rib. The potatoes were so tasty. I used small round potatoes and cut them in half. I also added onion powder, garlic powder instead of minced garlic, a bit of parsley and dry mustard. They turned out awesome. I picked this recipe because of the reviewers comments. So thank you to everyone who took the time to review this recipe.
Oh boy are these good. Love the way all the spices make these potatoes taste. A regular on our menu.

So easy and delicious, but takes time, probably because I made a 5 lb bag of potatoes in a larger Roasting pan and adjusted the amount of ingredients accordingly. Also added Thyme and Rosemary- you can add any spices you prefer. When adding liquid also added 10 garlic cloves halved. Excellent dish!!! Family and friends loved it.

Am having fun with this recipe. I'm an inexperienced foot-dragging sort of cook so recipe play is something new. Have made it four times, making slight changes each go-round.
475 was too high in my oven, causing pieces on the sides of the pan to burn a bit, so I reduced it to 425 and increased the cooking time from 20/30 to 40 minutes.
Have used all the spices with each attempt, subbing garlic powder for minced garlic a couple times, deciding the bottled minced garlic was as good, not better. 
The red pepper flakes made it too spicy for husband so I left them out altogether and added ordinary ground pepper to my serving.
The fun part came from adding big pieces of one each green, yellow and orange bell peppers, one cabana pepper and a large sweet onion. The fourth time I reduced the potatoes to about three, thereby changing up the proportion of potatoes to veggies so reduce starch.
One time I added cherry tomatoes I had on hand.
At my cooking time/temp the peppers and onion are softer than some folks might prefer but the potatoes are cooked through. Really dislike half-cooked potatoes.
Doubled the oil and spices to accommodate the veggies. There was too much bulk for a cookie sheet but my giant lasagna pan with 5" sides worked perfectly. The potatoes wanted to stick and burn, despite interim stirring. Lining with foil, sprayed with cooking oil made cleanup easier.
On the 4th attempt I added a couple cups of large white mushrooms, just washed and halved. Didn't know
Yum! Done to perfection. Just needed a little more salt for my taste.
This is the second time making it. It's absolutely delicious and has just the right amount of kick from the red pepper flakes.
I didn't have a marjoram, thyme or dill. I added some onion soup mix to the other herbs. It was great and hubby asked for seconds. Can't wait to make it again.
Just eliminated a few herbs, crisp outside tender inside. Next time will make pieces smaller, they'll be even more crisp!!

This was so delicious and a family favorite!
I added more minced garlic.

Delicious, picky hubby even loved them. The only alteration I made was swapped out the red pepper flakes with Paprika since hubby can't handle spicy things. Used the leftovers for breakfast bowls the next day with poached eggs.

I followed this recipe exactly except that the baking was done in a NuWave oven that has a max temperature of 425 degrees. At about 20 minutes, the potatoes were done and plenty browned, but did not at all have a crispy outside. One thing I did do differently was to add the oil and all of the seasonings to a gallon zip lock bag. When I got them mixed together, they were thick and paste-like. So I spread them out in the bag and coated both sides of the bag before adding the potatoes. This made it easier to coat all of the potatoes than trying to mix them in a bowl. The resulting potatoes were tasty, but the outside was leathery rather than crispy. Next time, I may try broiling them to crisp them, but if this is necessary, it should be included in the recipe. By the way, the insides of the potatoes were perfect. I just wasn't happy with the lack of crispness.

Loved this recipe. It's been a while since I made roasted potatoes so I came around to this recipe and it's just right! I supplemented different herbs that I had vs. some in the recipe which I lacked. I also used a "secret" ingredient seafood seasoning "old bay"
Cooked for longer at 365 since I had something else in the oven. Rating on Flavor.
I'll never buy frozen french fries again! So easy and so good!
love this
Fantastic recipe! It’s a little spicy, so adjust the red pepper flakes for your liking. The left overs were nice when added to scrambled eggs.
Love it! Quick and asy to do, had all the ingredients at home, and done in no time.
I loved this recipe! I used all the spices except for marjoram, didn't have any. I will continue to make this! My husband really liked them?? Thank you for sharing!

You can't go wrong with potatoes in my opinion. I thought these were great and will definitely be making them again. The only thing I didn't put on there was the crushed red pepper, just because I can't handle anything very spicy. I did leave them in a little longer than I should have and the smaller pieces where crispy on the outside but that wasn't' the recipes fault. Family loved them.
I made these as is exactly , until it came to the red pepper flakes. Omitted them. Baked for 30 minutes mixing them up every 10 minutes. Delish and thanks for sharing!
Prepared the potatoes as directed and my husband and I loved them. Adding to our cooking collection

These were so tasty, even my kids said this recipe "is a keeper." I reduced the red pepper flakes (I used crushed red pepper) to 1/4 tsp because we are wimps when it comes to spicy food.
The pan was hard to clean so I will use foil next time.

I'll do this one again and again. It is what I have been looking for, an easy, tasty way to take care of veggies for a group or just for us. Thanks! Our 4 guests also ate with gusto and asked for seconds.

Perfect as written. Lovely savory combination of herbs. My grandchildren loved nibbling the coating off the potatoes, and ate the potatoes as well. Don’t increase the oil or potatoes at center of the pan could get soggy. I made plain roasted potatoes tonight and my husband reminisced over this recipe I had made earlier in the week.
We like spicy food, salsas, etc. and this was too hot. The red pepper flakes totally overpowered the herbs. I'l make it again sans the pepper flakes.

I was disappointed in this recipe. It smelled and looked delicious going in the oven and even baked up beautifully. However, I didn't love the flavor, and I personally didn't love the way they were so crispy and really brown outside and still so soft inside. I have another favorite potato recipe that bakes for longer at 400. I think I'll stick with that combo for my potatoes. As far as the spices, I don't know if it was just too many different flavors going on or what, but the flavor was just really odd. I used a fraction of the red pepper and still thought they were randomly spicy without much flavor.

These taste pretty good- it's hard to go wrong with roasted potatoes- but I thought there were a few too many seasonings used. None of the flavors conflicted, but it was kind of an overpowering flavor combination for such a simple food. I did like the kick of the red pepper flakes, something I think you don't often see in recipes for this sort of dish.
